numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows how often young adults contact their parents.
2. I noticed that young women contact their parents more frequently than young men.
3. Many young women contact their parents at least once a day.
4. Many young women contact their parents a few times a week.
5. Young men contact their parents less frequently than young women.
6. The graph shows different forms of communication.
7. Most young men contact their parents by sending text messages.
8. 50% of young men contact their parents by sending text messages.
9. Most young women contact their parents by sending text messages.
10. 75% of young women contact their parents by sending text messages.
11. Text messages can be a faster form of communication than phone calls.
12. Text messages can be a faster form of communication than video chats.
13. Text messages can be a faster form of communication than visits in person.
14. I wonder whether young people prefer text messages because text messages are fast.
15. I wonder whether young people prefer text messages because text messages are convenient.
16. I ask why the frequency of contact differs between young men and young women.
17. The survey includes young adults who are close to 18 years old.
18. The survey includes young adults who are close to 34 years old.
19. I wonder whether young adults who are close to 18 years old contact their parents more often than young adults who are close to 34 years old.
20. I wonder whether young adults who are close to 18 years old contact their parents less often than young adults who are close to 34 years old.
21. Some young adults do not contact their parents.
22. Some young adults were screened out of the survey.
23. I ask how many young adults do not contact their parents.
24. I am 18 years old.
25. I will move to college this year.
26. I wonder which form of communication I will rely on most to contact my parents.
27. I ask how my age will impact how frequently I contact my parents.
28. I ask how my age will impact which form of communication I use to contact my parents.
29. This graph relates to my community.
30. This graph can demonstrate the closeness of parent-child relationships in my community.
31. This graph can demonstrate the dependence of young adults on their parents in adulthood.
